result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo D Roman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all  other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.
Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Complete anger management class.
Complete parenting class.
The court ordered that modifications to the no contact order will be governed by the Family Court and Children's Court order.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve 90 days as a condition of probation, huber release privileges for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo D Roman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo D Roman in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Ricardo D Roman in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay and Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Case is scheduled for a plea and sentencing date.
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive,  with credit for 4 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent,  with the following conditions:.
-  Defendant to serve 90 days as a condition of probation, huber release privileges for work.
- Complete anger management class.
-  Complete parenting class.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- The court ordered that modifications to the no contact order will be governed by the Family Court and Children's Court orderw.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all  other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Ricardo D Roman not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo D Roman in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Ricardo D Roman in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel requests another status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Ricardo D Roman not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant has been charged with a felony case.
Case adjourned for a status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Ricardo D Roman not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Court ordered case adjourned for another status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Ricardo D Roman not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The court was informed that the defendant is currently in custody, facing new charges in case 15CF3790.  Case adjourned for a status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo D Roman in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is still missing some discovery. Defense requested a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo D Roman in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Due to conflict, defense motioned to withdraw as counsel, GRANTED by the court.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Court held right to substitution open through end of next court date. Case adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Peggy R. and 742 S. Shea Ave., Milwaukee, WI.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ricardo D Roman in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Ricardo D Roman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
